item.title: lab 06- Pinting unwanted values
item.description:
by E/13/276 M.R.R.B Rajasooriya.  

Its about lab 6,the encriptor. It prints unwanted charactors in the terminal with the expected charactor. Sometimes it does not display the expected charactor but it displays a charactor which I dont know what it is.May be its printing something which is not in the range of the ascii values of the english alpabet.

As an example when I give shift '3' and the text 'A', it should display 'D' .But it only prints that unexpected charactor.

How can I fix it?

item.title: Having to press control+D twice for EOF
item.description:
by Hasindu Gamaarachchi.  

Some had an issue during today's lab, where at the middle of a line pressing control+D once would not mark the EOF. The reason is as follows.

In Linux EOF is triggered by one of following methods.
1.pressing control+D at the beginning of a new line.
2.pressing Control+D twice consecutively during the middle of a line.

For more info refer 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21260674/why-do-i-need-to-type-ctrl-d-twice-to-mark-end-of-file

2.pressing Control+D twice consectively during the middle of a line

item.title: Reading assigment submission time
item.description:
by E/13/276 M.R.R.B Rajasooriya.  

In the reading assignment based on "operators" ,all others had the submission time at 9.00pm on 9th february,except me. I had the submission time on 7.30 a.m in the morning on the same day and I completed the assignment after 7.30 a.m.. Why was that only I had to submit it on so early than others?

item.title: opening an installed application using terminal
item.description:
by E/13/285 Kavin Ranawella.  

for some applications like libeoffice, typing the name directly will open up the application. but sometimes it won't work, like in the case of opening 'screenshot'.

So, is there a way that we can get to know the list of such words used to open apps.

thanks.
